bug.author: nthmost
bug.summary: st.number_input silently fails to allow de/increment of integer when initial value was float
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>import streamlit as st st.number_input(label="float displayed as integer", format="%i", value=2.4) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Streamlit should allow de/incrementing on the NumberInput widget. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
NumberInput widget does not allow de/incrementing of the integer. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
no <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.52.0 Python version: any Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? Pex? pipenv OS version: OSX Browser version: Chrome
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
The st.number_input widget wants total concordance in its arguments, i.e. if the "value" submitted as the default is a float, the "step" parameter should be a float as well. This is currently an error the user will see if their arguments are out of concordance.

comments.comment: Reopening b/c a previous decision at Streamlit was made to never have format change the value. I will revert this change accordingly. Hoping for discussion at eng meeting today about whether to warn user when the format is int but the value is a float.
OK yep, we will make a warning either in Python or in Javascript.
Here's a warning we could show. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/98836/72378332-0562b180-36c6-11ea-8d99-0eedb71881c4.png></denchmark-link>
Hey, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nthmost>@nthmost</denchmark-link> is there a way to suppress the warning?
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kashyapm94>@kashyapm94</denchmark-link> , at the moment there's no way to suppress this warning. I can open a feature request for this.
